page.title: 16THE GAMEKEEPER, BRODICK
page.content: I am the gamekeeper's daughter,Lindsay Ross, and live at The Kennels in the Castle grounds.The Kennels are about 100 years old and 40 pointers were kept here for hunting grouse.1400 grouse were shot each year until 30 years ago.They have declined in number and today less are shot in the hope that numbers recover.In February my father is concerned with vermin control- hooded crows, mink etc. After heather burning to encourage new growth in Spring, the checking and repair of fencing is done to keep deer off the road. Pheasant eggs are collected in the Spring and hatched under broodie hens before releasing later in the year. A deer management programme is carried out and a close watch is kept on the overall deer population which a the moment stands at 1500 on the island.
